title: Confusing error with custom attributes and use_extern_macros

body:
I'm getting a confusing error message when I use custom attributes (with custom derive), and the `use_extern_macros` feature.

To reproduce, you can use a trivially small custom derive crate:

```rust
extern crate proc_macro;

use proc_macro::TokenStream;

#[proc_macro_derive(MyTrait, attributes(MyAttr))]
pub fn my_trait_derive(input: TokenStream) -> TokenStream {
    use std::str::FromStr;
    TokenStream::from_str("").unwrap()
}
```


And then in your main lib.rs file:

```rust
#![feature(use_extern_macros)]

#[macro_use]
extern crate my_derive;  // my custom derive crate


pub trait MyTrait { }

mod common {

    use super::MyTrait;

    #[derive(MyTrait)]
    pub struct size {
        #[MyAttr]
        pub x: i32,
    }
}

pub use self::common::*; // Line A

mod raw {

    use super::MyTrait;

    #[derive(MyTrait)]
    struct raw { }
}

pub use self::raw::*; // Line B
```

Trying to build this yields the following error:

```
error: The attribute `MyAttr` is currently unknown to the compiler and may have meaning added to it in the future (see issue #29642)
  --> src/lib.rs:15:9
   |
15 |         #[MyAttr]
   |         ^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = help: add #![feature(custom_attribute)] to the crate attributes to enable

error: aborting due to previous error

error: Could not compile `custom_derive_test`.
```


Now the weird part is that if you remove **Line A** *or* **Line B**, the code will compile without error.

(And of course removing the `use_extern_macros` feature will make this code compile)
